segments.Text:
This text was transcribed using whisper model: large-v2

 Thank you very much.
As you see, I am Red Teamer Guy.
From more than 10 years, I am a Pentester.
I am breaking stuff, mostly in Logical Trust.
We are doing, of course, web application penetration tests, mobile application penetration tests,
external and internal network, and we are testing people, too.
When you get this together, it's something like Red Teaming.
Of course, we will talk about Red Teaming attacks today.
All cases are from Poland, from Polish companies, which is the most important thing from my
perspective here, that Red Teaming is that kind of test where we are trying to be as
much as possible like cybercriminals, because those guys, they are not interested in, I
don't know, if your company's compliance with ISO 27001 or your team have, I don't know,
CISP certification or something like that.
They want to steal your money.
They want to steal your source code, your IP stuff.
So that kind of test, it's rather new stuff in Poland, but I believe that we will have
much more tests like that in the next years.
Of course, the scope here is much wider, so we have some rules, but for example, usually
only a few people knew that the tests are coming, because in that kind of test, we are
trying to see how company react, how employee will do their blue stuff.
So we have some rules, but they are completely different than, you know, ordinary penetration
tests where we are testing two applications in exact version or something like that.
When we are talking about the phishing, I believe that is the best solution if you are
trying to get some kind of money for the security area, because you will never fail.
If you will ever, if you will do any kind of tests for your company, I'm sure that you
will get some passwords from employees.
It can be dangerous, because your colleagues can hate you after all, so you have to be
careful, but that's examples of numbers of employees who gave us their passwords from
a few tests.
I will talk later about this example.
It's nice, because in the 15 minutes we got about 30%, I will show you why this number
was so low here.
So I believe that you should try to test your company even in the simplest way to buy, you
know, the similar domain and try to see how employee will react.
Okay, some stories from our tests.
We get two times the guys who write down the nice version of the password which we got,
because the IT guys, they knew that something is wrong, so probably someone is trying to
steal the data from the company, so they were trying to be not so nice to us.
They didn't know that it was prepared, so they were thinking that maybe that are some
kind of cybercriminals.
That's the worst option if we are talking about incident management.
You should not try to be, you should be polite with some guys who maybe, you know, get all
your passwords a few minutes ago.
In the other case, the IT staff was trying to DDoS us, so they were sending many, many
packets to our phishing websites.
Of course, we were in the cloud, so we can rapidly increase our performance.
We made one fail once, because you can use, you know, CC header or BCC header, in that
kind of stuff, the other employee, when they see the other people from the company, they
trust that male much more.
But in our case, which was this case from here, a few weeks ago, one woman got married,
so she changed the name, and we didn't find it in the recon phase, so one guy saw that
something is wrong, because this girl is using another different email from a few weeks.
So, it was the case with the running employee.
It's something like the best IPS system in the world, it's the guy who, when he recognized
that some phishing or some kind of attacks, this guy is running around the floors, around
the building, and screaming, don't click on this mail, don't click on this mail.
So, that's strange education, but it can work, so this number can be lowered.
It always depends on the company, on the hour when you are starting to send the emails and
et cetera.
You have to be careful when you are the blue team, because once the guys in Poland, when
they react after about half an hour, they are trying to drop our connection on the firewall,
but they do this only for the Polish part of the company, but we were targeting the
few countries, so still we get the passwords from other companies, from other countries.
If you are thinking about the malicious software, any kind of malware, it doesn't matter what
they use in any kind of case, the best option, in my opinion, is to be very specific, not
sending 1,000 of the same email, but choose some groups, choose some kind of employee.
For example, if you know that they like, I don't know, Justin Bieber, music, send them
a special promo code or promo ticket for the concert or for something like that.
It's really high value for employees.
Of course, in the simplest form, it can be any kind of office file and people still click
on it, it should be much more complicated, but still if you are trying to test your company,
you can do it in the simplest way.
You can use some kind of strange font here and people will want to see it.
And again, our cases, once the girl had a problem with the attachment, so she forwarded
our malware to the IT guy, it was an administrator guy, so he clicked on it, so in one email
we got two computers and one was the administrator staff.
Once we found the two antivirus solutions on the computer, on the workstation, so it
was funny to see the processes that, okay, they are two components who are trying to
defend the host and the network.
Once in a few hours when we infected the workstation from a woman from the HR department,
in a few hours we get the source code, so the question is how bad the network was separated.
In the other kind of tests, where we were testing the internet network, once we found
the Quake 1 server and we were really surprised.
My colleague Mateusz is still playing in this Quake 1 game, so he was very happy and
after a few hours he found the one zero day who gave him the administrator access but
in the Quake, so he could kick the players or change the map.
And after the next few hours, he found the other zero days and from this administrator
in the Quake, we run the code on the server and after all, we found some configuration
errors and we get to the other backend servers and after all, we get the whole information
from the company, even with the VPN access to their internal network.
In other case, we started from some kind of CMS, we didn't have any kind of credentials,
brute force doesn't work, so we called the company who produced the CMS and we asked
them about the demo of this product and with this data, it was much easier, we found some
vulnerabilities in the web application.
From the web application, we found on the backend some kind of really simple password
From that, we found a redundant resource, there was some kind of virtual machine image,
so we downloaded it, it was about 4 gigabytes of data and there we found some passwords,
we cracked them and they used the same passwords on other Windows server machines and we realized
that they are using some kind of schema of password creation, so after a few tries, we
get the admin on the AD and we realized that okay, with this access, we can click to log
into a VMware and authenticate with AD, so we take over here more than 100 servers.
If we are talking about some kind of physical security, of course we have a lot of stuff
here, it depends what we are trying to use, what kind of assessments are we doing.
I will tell you some stories from that kind of physical red teaming stuff.
The most important thing, I believe, is that you should be really, really prepared.
You have to use some kind of fake stories, you have to use fake business cards and etc.
In one company, I was walking upstairs on some kind of external staircase and I was
going with a big backpack with some smartphone and I was trying to test the Wi-Fi network
and I was taking the Wi-Fi packets and checking the signal, level of the signal and in that
particular case, one guy was going down and asked me, stop, what are you doing here?
Why are you here?
It's strange.
Why are you always going by the stairs?
But I was well prepared and I told him that, you know, in the building you have many offices
of some company and the quality of GSM network is very low, so we are from the external company,
we are measuring some kind of quality of the signal because this company wants to add some
new antennas, probably not this problem.
And he answered, yeah, yeah, of course, it's really bad quality signal inside the building.
And of course, after all, we meet on some kind of Finnish meeting and we were joking
that he didn't realise that we were the guys who were trying to break some stuff.
When we are talking about the access control system, I will tell you two cases.
We are talking about companies where you should use some kind of RFID cards to get
into the office of the company and, of course, like in every kind of, especially red teaming
stuff, this recon phase is the crucial.
So you have to do a really good job in your recon phase and when you will do it, it will
be much easier to take over almost everything.
In the one case, we realised that in the building, even if you want to use the elevators, you
have to have that kind of cards.
But after a few days of reconnaissance, we realised that there is one company on the
one floor where you can get the access without these special cards.
So we went there and we are trying to walk by the building everywhere.
So we found that it's possible to go downstairs with the staircase and we can open the door
from the staircase to the corridor near the office area.
They were using these RFID cards and, again, we spent some time to check how they are using
it.
And it was really simple because we can use here some kind of social engineering technique
because early morning, every about 30, 60 minutes, some employee was going into the
company and the reception was without any kind of people at early morning.
So I went behind that person and usually they don't see really anything.
They were going really fast, only, you know, beep the RFID card and they were going to
the offices.
I will tell you how it finished in the next slides.
And in the other case, I was doing some kind of recon part, so I didn't have every kind
of tool set which I can use, but I have only a few devices, like, for example, Lantartal,
probably you know it, it's a small computer.
And in the recon phase, when I was doing some kind of hidden photos, hidden videos,
I realized that one door was not closed.
And of course, I was thinking, okay, it's the office time, it's the recon, but maybe
you know, I will be lucky, we will see.
So I got into one room and I will tell you what will be later.
From this first example, I was in some kind of office space, I was there with the other
people who were in the other rooms, so I didn't have too much time.
So I phone to, you know, Ethernet socket and in the second, I see that I got the connection
from Lantartal, so I hide this device, of course, and I put it near some shelves and
it gives us some kind of reverse connection to the internal network from the Internet.
And of course, I go out from this company and after a few days, they still didn't realize
that we are in the internal company, that they have that kind of plug, so this recon
lucky moment was really good for us.
And once when I went after this ‑‑ behind this employee, I turned left to the meeting
room and I sit there, I turn off the lights, I open my computer, because I was trying to,
you know, to look confident, to look like the guy who is waiting for someone.
Of course, I have some kind of papers with some kind of marketing bullshit stuff, which
I can show if someone will ask, and the rules here was that I have only two hours to see
what I can do, so I was trying first, of course, to connect to the network with the first cable,
which was for the guests, but this network was isolated, I didn't have access to any
kind of internal network stuff.
So I was trying to figure out what I can do more, and I was walking by the room, and I
found some kind of devices, which was used to teleconference.
So I get the cables from this teleconference system, I plug into my computer, and I realized
that okay, I am in a completely different villa, and I had access to the internal servers.
So it was really nice, I installed a few things in the next hour, and at the end, I found
one computer, this computer was to probably to, you know, to present some kind of slides,
and I was interested in what I can do, I had only 10 or 15 minutes, so I cloned the
Mac from this computer, because I connect to both computers, and I cloned this Mac,
and I connect this first cable, which I test aerial, with this cloned Mac of this computer,
and again, I got the access to internal network with all workstation.
So the last story, the last story is about some kind of server room in the company, company
where they told us that it's impossible to get there, because it's inside the office,
it's really like the castle, so it was like, you know, mission impossible, and kind of
social engineering techniques will fail, probably because they train red teaming staff
every year, so we are trying to think completely different, and we found a guy who was in their
server rooms about a few months ago, because he was some kind of guy from the company who
was servicing the power lines to these server rooms, so we found the guy, we hired him,
we told him the story, of course we paid him, we told him that okay, we will pay you more
if you will get the pictures from the server room, that you will show us and the company
that it's possible to go there, and for example, to put a rubber ducky in your USB plug to
take over some servers, because it's unusual, but you can do this too.
So he agreed, and he went to the owner of the building, some kind of security officers,
because he knows them, and he asked one guy from the building, maybe he can go with him,
so he looks much more confident from the company perspective, of course we chose the
day where the main IT admin guy was on some kind of holiday, it was from the recon phase
of course, and he was trying to convince the people inside with some kind of junior IT
guys that he's from not our city, he has to do this kind of work, it's very important,
and he's here with this guy from the building, so they should trust him, and it took about
15 minutes, and in general they got in, so it was another example that if you are trying
really hard, always you will get in. And at the summary, you should always realize, I believe,
that if you are here, you know it, that today everything is possible, so try to increase the
cost of attackers, because it can slow down them, and what is funny here, that security is a process
where we realize that when we are trying to test any kind of companies who are making
red teaming tests, every year it's some kind of harder, so it works. That kind of really,
really old sentence. In our case, always after of course some kind of report, after some kind
of summary, we are giving the employees some kind of education platform, and what's the most
important here, and I believe that you should do it in your companies too, if you are working in
the blue team, you should do some kind of presentation for the employees, now you should
talk how some companies hacked us, you can show the LAN turtle, you can show them a rubber
ducky, or similar devices, it always works, they are very surprised, and that's the best way of
education, because in the next few weeks, in the social rooms, they will discuss, they will discuss
about this, you know, interesting kind of security test like red teaming is, so I really believe that
it can really increase your line of defense, and at the end some kind of few last words, of course
the blue teams, they have really hard work, yeah, we know it, it's really easy to be, you know, in the
red trousers and then to attack the companies, it's really hard work, a lot of stuff they have
to do, they have to learn, so only a few important things, I believe that here, this middle part is
the crucial, any kind of training which you can do in your companies is really important, of course
like we saw in the last presentation, some kind of correlation of logs is important too, especially
today when we have really a lot of data from, you know, all the systems. If you are some kind of
bigger company, maybe you had some staff to the forensic, maybe you can hire the, you know, external
company, of course all staff, which I'm talking from more than 10 years, updates your vulnerabilities
and updates your software, and again, you should try to slow down the attackers, yeah, because it gives you
a time, it gives you maybe a possibility to detect them earlier, or if they're not, if you're not in some
kind of targeted attack, maybe, you know, they will jump into the other target. At the end, some kind of
other, our videos from the conferences, and if you are interested in our technical trainings from web
application penetration test or mobile, there is a discount for you, you can use it, and maybe you
will see me on some kind of training. Thank you for your attention very much.
Of course, if you have any kind of question, I will try to lie you, to answer.
What should be to the IT sector in the future?
That kind of tests are very sensitive, and of course, beside of many, many lines in the contracts, which are, you know,
prepared by the lawyer, of course, you have to be always prepared with some kind of emergency plan, even if you are
doing that kind of physics stuff, we are always, we have always one guy in the company who knows that in that
particular time, we are there, yeah, because, you know, some guys from the company can think that we are stealing
the stuff or something like that, yeah, we are from Poland, so, we are in Poland and from Poland, so, you know,
everyone can think that someone is stealing something, yeah, we don't know this guy, so you always should have
some kind of emergency plan, and usually, we are in the strict communication with the one person, one person who knows
what we are doing, that, for example, in that particular time, we are doing some kind of, I don't know, recon on the
internet site, so, less people know about our stuff, but it's, yeah, it's crucial, it's always some kind of risk, yeah,
that, I don't know, they will call police or something like that, we know one case from the other company who is doing
corrective test, that, after all, when they, you know, completely breached the company, the main boss of the company told that
I didn't know that it was a test, because, of course, he clicked on something, and we will not pay you, so, of course,
probably, I don't know, they will finish in the carter or something like that, yeah.
